title: SoC CSD 497-0-20 Swallow Physiology and Pathology

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Students will learn the anatomy and physiology of normal swallowing and the anatomic and physiologic disturbances that affect deglutition. Students will acquire fundamental skills in radiographic and bedside diagnostic and treatment procedures. Clinical decision-making and care planning processes based in research evidence and evaluation findings will be discussed. Students will complete laboratory experiences in evaluation procedures and restorative interventions.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Book #1:

Author: Logemann, J.A.
Title: Evaluation and Treatment of Swallowing Disorders
Edition: 2nd (1998)
Publisher: Pro-Ed
ISBN: 9780890797280

Required or recommended: REQUIRED

Book #2:
Author: Logemann, J.A.
Title: Manual for the Videofluorographic Study of Swallowing
Edition: 2nd (1993)
Publisher: Pro-Ed
ISBN: 9780890795842
Required or recommended: REQUIRED
